comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: Marie Curie was the prime mover in the organization of portable x-ray units which could be brought to the battle fronts in World War I. It is now thought that her fatal leukemia was not brought on by her earlier work with radium, but by the thousands of x-rays she took during the war. www.acr.org/SecondaryMainMenuCategories/NewsPublications/... www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC1229859/pdf/cmaj_159...

comment.author: 77496405@N02
comment._content: Is this a real radiology lab from so long ago? That seems strange. I guess I just always associate things like pacs radiology with the modern world and not really the ages of black and white photos. You know? I find it rather interesting.
